label: Description
value: Trees are at left and in the right middle plane. A part of the pond is shown in front of the latter. A man kneels at its edge, another is shown from the back seated and raising his right hand toward a boat. A peasant's house is beyond the pond. Mountains are in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: The nude goddess kneels behind and gazes at a young man lying on the couch with his head at left. Spear and horn are lying in the foreground. A tree is shown at left. Attributed to Pasquale Marini.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: A burning lamp is shown in full length with the handle at right. A nude man kneels at right, holding a jar over the raised jet.

value: Graphite, brush and sepia on paper

value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: A circular base with fluting. Atlas, a bearded nude male, carries the globe, the equator of which is surrounded by a band. To this band are fastened two bowls with flames. Suspended are chains from which hand screwdrivers.
